convertLdapObjectGuidBytesToString
The function is used when retrieving data from Microsoft Active Directory (hereinafter - AD) directory service to convert the objectGUID identifier into a GUID format string.
Syntax
convertLdapObjectGuidBytesToString
(objectGUID)
Parameter
Purpose
objectGUID
The objectGUID identifier as a byte array.
The objectGUID must first be retrieved using the
searchLdapEntry
function.
Note
The function is added by manual entry.
Use example
For example, when retrieving data from the AD directory service, it is required to convert the objectGUID to a GUID format string.
The algorithm can be as follows:
When the algorithm is written using the
searchLdapEntry
function, a search query is sent to the AD directory service.
The first element of the objectGuid attribute of the first search result, which is an array of bytes, is then assigned to the objectGuid variable.
The byte array is then converted to a GUID format string using the
convertLdapObjectGuidBytesToString
function.
